alert.note: Alert for Big Horn (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 16 at 2:51PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is occurring and expected to continue. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Big Horn. Flooding has been reported in Manderson along the Big Horn River and river rises have also been noted downstream at Basin. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 245 PM MDT, emergency management reported an ice jam near Manderson. Minor flooding is already occurring. Emergency management has also reported that river levels are rising rapidly around Basin and minor flooding may be possible if the river continues to rise. - Manderson is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Basin and Manderson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
